workflow.name: üè´ English lesson generator from podcasts with RSS, GPT-4, ElevenLabs and Gmail
workflow.description:
*Tags: ESL, English Learning, Podcasts, RSS, AI Exercises, ElevenLabs*

### Context

Hi! I‚Äôm [Samir](https://samirsaci.com), Supply Chain Engineer and Data Scientist based in Paris, and founder of the startup [LogiGreen](https://logi-green.com).

I created this workflow for my mother, who is currently learning English, to turn the **BBC 6 Minute English** podcast into ready-to-use English lessons.

[![Workflow Overview](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/size/w1600/2025/11/image-20.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IKugAVZWgKM)

The lesson includes vocabulary, exercises and discussion questions along with links to access the podcast content (audio and transcript).

> Use this assistant to automatically share English lessons from a renowned podcast.


üì¨ For business inquiries, you can find me on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/samir-saci)

### Who is this template for?

This template is designed for:

- **ESL teachers** who want a fresh, structured lesson every week from real-life audio
- **Independent learners** who want a guided way to study English with podcasts
- **Language schools or content creators** who send regular English lessons by email

### What does this workflow do?

This workflow acts as an **AI-powered English lesson generator** from podcast episodes.

1. **Runs every Sunday at 20:00** using a Schedule Trigger and reads the BBC **6 Minute English** RSS feed  
2. **Checks a Data Table of archived episodes** and filters out those already sent (using their `guid`)  
3. **Keeps the latest unsent episode** and loads its web page content via HTTP  
4. **Parses the HTML** in a Code node to extract the episode **description**, full **transcript** and BBC **vocabulary list**  
5. **Calls three AI nodes** (OpenAI) to generate:
   - a motivational **email hook message**
   - **fill-in-the-blank vocabulary exercises**
   - **discussion questions** related to the topic  
6. **Combines all vocabulary words** and sends them to **ElevenLabs** to generate a slow-paced audio track for listening practice  
7. **Builds a prettify HTML email** that includes: title, description, hook, vocabulary list, exercises, discussion questions and resource links  
8. **Sends the final lesson by email** via the Gmail node, with the vocabulary audio attached  

For example, this is the latest email generated by the workflow:

[![Email Screenshot](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/size/w1600/2025/11/image-19.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IKugAVZWgKM)

*P.S.: You can customise the footer to your school or company identity.*

### üé• Tutorial

I advise you to check the tutorial on my YouTube channel for the details on how to set up the nodes and customise the content:

[![Tutorial + Demo](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/2025/11/image-22.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IKugAVZWgKM)

### Next Steps

Follow the stickers to set up all the nodes:

- Replace the **Data Table** reference with your own (storing at least `guid`, `title`, `link`, `processed_date`)  
- Set up your **OpenAI** credentials in the three Model nodes  
- Set up your **ElevenLabs** credentials and choose a voice in the audio node  
- Configure your **Gmail** credentials and recipient email address in the Send Email node  
- Adapt the **RSS feed URL** if you want to track another podcast or source  
- Customise the **HTML email** (colours, logo, footer text) in the `Prepare Email` Code node  
- Adjust the **schedule** (time or frequency) if you prefer another cadence  

*Submitted: 18 November 2025*  
*Template designed with n8n version 1.116.2*

parameters.text:
=Create 5 engaging discussion questions based on this BBC 6 Minute English episode:

Episode: {{ $json.episode_title }}
Description: {{ $json.description }}
Transcript excerpt: {{ $json.transcript }}...

Requirements:
1. Questions should encourage personal opinions and experiences
2. Range from easier (personal reaction) to more complex (critical thinking)
3. Make students want to TALK and share their views
4. Connect to students' real lives when possible
5. Use some of the target vocabulary naturally: {{ $json.vocabulary_items.map(v => v.word).join(', ') }}
6. Keep language at B1-B2 level
7. Avoid yes/no questions - ask WHY, HOW, WHAT IF

Format: Return ONLY the 5 questions, one per line, without numbering (I'll add numbers automatically).

Example questions:
What's your opinion on [topic]? Have you experienced something similar?
If you could [hypothetical], what would you do and why?
How do you think [topic] will change in the next 10 years?

options.systemMessage: =You are an experienced ESL teacher creating vocabulary practice exercises for intermediate learners.

parameters.text:
=Create {{ $json.vocabulary_count }} fill-in-the-blank practice sentences using these vocabulary words from the BBC episode:

{{ $json.vocabulary_items.map((v, i) => `${i+1}. ${v.word}: ${v.definition}`).join('\n') }}

Requirements:
- Create ONE sentence for EACH vocabulary word
- Sentences should be realistic and practical (situations students might encounter)
- Leave a blank (use "_______") where the vocabulary word should go
- Make sentences progressively slightly more challenging
- Ensure context makes the answer clear
- Use B1-B2 level English for the sentences
- DO NOT number the sentences (I'll add numbers automatically)

Format: Return ONLY the sentences, one per line, with _______ for the blank.

Example:
When I saw the final exam results, my _______ in complete shock.
The researcher proposed a new _______ to explain the strange phenomenon.

options.systemMessage: =You are an experienced ESL teacher creating vocabulary practice exercises for intermediate learners.

parameters.text:
=Create a compelling 3-paragraph hook message to convince a student to listen to this BBC 6 Minute English podcast episode. Episode: "{{ $json.episode_title }}" Description: "{{ $json.description }}" Vocabulary focus: {{ $json.vocabulary_items.map(v => v.word).join(', ') }} Requirements: 1. Start with an intriguing question, surprising fact, or "did you know" statement related to the topic 2. Explain what the student will learn in 6 minutes (keep emphasizing the short time commitment) 3. Highlight the vocabulary they'll master 4. End with an energetic call-to-action 5. Use 2-3 emojis strategically (at the start of paragraphs) 6. Keep language clear and encouraging (B1-B2 level) 7. Make it feel personal and conversational, not robotic Format: Return 3 paragraphs separated by

tags (for HTML email compatibility). DO NOT use markdown formatting. DO NOT use * for bold - use tags instead. Example style: "üåç Did you know that [fascinating fact]? [Build curiosity]

In just 6 minutes, you'll [what they'll learn]. You'll master expressions like "[vocab example]" and "[vocab example]" while [exploring the topic].

Ready to [motivating challenge]? This episode is perfect for your [coffee break/commute/lunch] and you'll walk away with [specific benefit]!

options.systemMessage: =You are an enthusiastic English learning coach who writes engaging, motivational content for intermediate English learners (B1-B2 level).

parameters.content: ## 6. Build and send the HTML study email with vocabulary audio attached

## AI English Lesson Generator from Podcasts

### How it works
1. A trigger runs every Sunday at 20:00 and reads the BBC **6 Minute English** RSS feed  
2. Previously sent episodes are looked up in the Data Table and filtered out using their `guid`  
3. The workflow keeps the latest unsent episode and loads its web page content  
4. A Code node parses the HTML to extract the **description**, full **transcript** and BBC **vocabulary list**  
5. Three AI nodes generate: a hook message, fill-in-the-blank exercises and discussion questions based on the episode  
6. The vocabulary words are combined and sent to **ElevenLabs** to generate a slow-paced audio track  
7. All sections are merged into a single HTML email and sent via **Gmail**, with the vocabulary audio attached  

### How to set up
- [ ] Create a **Data Table** with the fields: `guid`, `title`, `link`, `processed_date`
- [ ] Connect the Data Table to **Archived Podcasts**, **Unique guid(s)** and **Combine with archived guid(s)**  
- [ ] Add your OpenAI credentials to the three **Model** nodes (hook, practice, discussion)  
- [ ] Add your ElevenLabs credentials in **Generate Audio Transcript** and pick a voice  
- [ ] Configure your Gmail credentials and destination address in **Send Email**  

### Customisation
1. Change the schedule time or frequency in the **Trigger Sunday 20:00** node  
2. Edit the prompts in the AI nodes to change tone or difficulty level  
3. Customise the HTML email template and footer in **Prepare Email** with your own branding
## 4. Generate hook and exercises from the episode content
## 3. Select latest unsent episode and fetch its page content
## 2. Filter out podcasts that have already been sent
## 1. Weekly trigger to fetch RSS feed and load archived GUIDs

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
